author: cnbc.com
title: CACI President of U.S. Operations DeEtte Gray Appointed Chair of AFCEA International Board of Directors
text:
ARLINGTON, Va.--(BUSINESS WIRE)-- CACI International Inc ( NYSE: CACI ) announced today that President of U.S. Operations DeEtte Gray has been appointed Chair of AFCEA International’s Board of Directors. Ms. Gray’s two-year term commenced May 14, 2018. The AFCEA Executive Committee and Board of Directors consists of leaders from the defense, intelligence, and academic communities that is representative of the association’s diverse membership and inclusive of individuals from the next generation of leaders. Ms. Gray had previously served as the Board’s Vice Chair.
AFCEA was established in 1946 as a non-profit membership association dedicated to increasing knowledge through the exploration of issues relevant to its members in information technology, communications, and electronics for the defense, homeland security, and intelligence communities.
As Chair of the Board of Directors, Ms. Gray will lead AFCEA in its mission to support its members and plan for its future. She will oversee the affairs of the association, presiding over the council, the Board of Directors, and the Executive Committee, and serves as ex officio member of all association committees and subcommittees.
At CACI, Ms. Gray leads the company’s U.S. Operations business groups in delivering operational excellence and driving company growth. She has over 20 years of experience supporting IT technology, cyber security, and intelligence customers and contributes significantly to CACI’s strategic planning. Her appointment reflects CACI’s commitment to AFCEA’s goals for advancing our nation through partnering and communication among government, industry, and academia.
According to Ms. Gray, “As a long-time AFCEA member, I am honored to be selected as Chair of the Board of Directors for such an important and recognized organization in the IT and intelligence communities. CACI’s goals align with AFCEA’s, and the information sharing AFCEA promotes helps industry stay vigilant to our government’s needs and opportunities. I look forward to applying my leadership experience to advance and address issues facing the AFCEA community.”
Ms. Gray’s appointment continues CACI’s long history of partnership with AFCEA. CACI employees have served in prominent roles in both international and local chapters, and the company regularly supports AFCEA activities promoting government-industry networking and STEM education. Ms. Gray herself is a strong proponent of STEM initiatives within both CACI and her local community.
CACI provides information solutions and services in support of national security missions and government transformation for Intelligence, Defense, and Federal Civilian customers. A Fortune World’s Most Admired Company, CACI is a member of the Fortune 1000 Largest Companies, the Russell 2000 Index, and the S&P SmallCap600 Index. CACI’s sustained commitment to ethics and integrity defines its corporate culture and drives its success. With approximately 18,600 employees worldwide, CACI provides dynamic career opportunities for military veterans and industry professionals to support the nation’s most critical missions. Join us! www.caci.com .
